definition[0]: next to the side of something
example[1]: Childrenâ€™s prices are shown alongside adult prices.
definition[1]: used to say that people or things do something or exist together at the same time
example[2]: Charles spent a week working alongside the miners.
example[3]: Organized crime continued to flourish alongside the mainstream economy.
example[4]: His achievement may seem small alongside the great triumphs of 20th-century technology.
example[5]: Athletics should rank alongside  (=be equal to) soccer and cricket as a major sport.
